, what is probability of at least 1 person pick up his/her own hat?
usually it s easier to calculate complement
ways that everyone picks wrong hat
1st person: N-1 hat to pick (except his own)
2nd person: N-2 hat to pick (pick from N-1 remaining hat, and not his/her own hat, so N-2 to pick from)
so (N-1)! way that everybody picks the wrong hat.
if 1st person picked the 2nd person's hat, there is
N-1 remaining hats to pick from
if 1st person picked another person (not 2nd person's hat and not 1st person's),
there is N-2 hats to pick from
